pages.text: Nichrome (NiCr, $(l:materials/Nickel)nickel$(/l)-$(l:materials/Chrome)chrome$(/l), $(l:materials/Chrome)chrome$(/l)-$(l:materials/Nickel)nickel$(/l), etc.) is any of various alloys of $(l:materials/Nickel)nickel$(/l), chromium, and often $(l:materials/Iron)iron$(/l) (and possibly other elements). The most common usage is as resistance wire, although they are also used in some dental restorations (fillings) and in a few other applications.
